page.title: 11Bathgate Hills Superstitions
page.content: The Bathgate Hills are very mysterious, especially The Knock, Cairnpapple and The Clinkin' Stane. Many years ago people were superstitious, they saw witches, skeletons in armour, hobgoblins and other kinds of monsters. A few people believe in the Clinkin' Stane, clinking at 12 midnight to commemorate the death of a man who had been fighting with another man over a woman. Cairnpapple is mysterious, it has a few axe heads from Llandudno and Rhyl, in North Wales. An axe head, found in Cairnpapple, was matched with one from Stonehenge. These axes were thought to have been used in sacrificial terms and in battling with other nearby tribes, trying to gain more territory. These battles were very vicious.
